00001 /**************************************************************************/
00002 /* This sample program provides code for a client application that uses     */
00003 /* AF_UNIX address family                                                 */
00004 /**************************************************************************/
00005 /**************************************************************************/
00006 /* Header files needed for this sample program                            */
00007 /**************************************************************************/
00008 #include <stdio.h>
00009 #include <string.h>
00010 #include <time.h>
00011 #include <sys/types.h>
00012 #include <sys/socket.h>
00013 #include <sys/un.h>
00014 
00015 #include "../src/headers/bro_fist.h"
00016 
00017 /**************************************************************************/
00018 /* Constants used by this program                                         */
00019 /**************************************************************************/
00020 #define SERVER_PATH      "/tmp/BROFist"
00021 #define BUFFER_LENGTH    250
00022 #define FALSE              0
00023 #define MSG_NUM 10000
00024 
00025 /* Pass in 1 parameter which is either the */
00026 /* path name of the server as a UNICODE    */
00027 /* string, or set the server path in the   */
00028 /* #define SERVER_PATH which is a CCSID    */
00029 /* 500 string.                             */
00030 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00031 {
00032     /***********************************************************************/
00033     /* Variable and structure definitions.                                 */
00034     /***********************************************************************/
00035     int    sd=-1, rc, bytesReceived, length, i;
00036     char   buffer[BUFFER_LENGTH];
00037     struct sockaddr_un serveraddr;
00038     bro_fist_t out_packet[BUFFER_SIZE];
00039     bro_fist_t in_packet[BUFFER_SIZE];
00040     time_t begin_trans, end_trans;
00041     
00042     memset (in_packet, 0, sizeof(bro_fist_t) * BUFFER_SIZE);
00043     memset (out_packet, 0, sizeof(bro_fist_t) * BUFFER_SIZE);
00044 
00045     /***********************************************************************/
00046     /* A do/while(FALSE) loop is used to make error cleanup easier.  The   */
00047     /* close() of the socket descriptor is only done once at the very end  */
00048     /* of the program.                                                     */
00049     /***********************************************************************/
00050     do
00051     {
00052         /********************************************************************/
00053         /* The socket() function returns a socket descriptor, which represents   */
00054         /* an endpoint.  The statement also identifies that the UNIX  */
00055         /* address family with the stream transport (SOCK_STREAM) will be   */
00056         /* used for this socket.                                            */
00057         /********************************************************************/
00058         sd = socket(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00059         if (sd < 0)
00060         {
00061             perror("socket() failed");
00062             break;
00063         }
00064 
00065         /********************************************************************/
00066         /* If an argument was passed in, use this as the server, otherwise  */
00067         /* use the #define that is located at the top of this program.      */
00068         /********************************************************************/
00069         memset(&serveraddr, 0, sizeof(serveraddr));
00070         serveraddr.sun_family = AF_UNIX;
00071         if (argc > 1)
00072             strcpy(serveraddr.sun_path, argv[1]);
00073         else
00074             strcpy(serveraddr.sun_path, SERVER_PATH);
00075 
00076         /********************************************************************/
00077         /* Use the connect() function to establish a connection to the      */
00078         /* server.                                                          */
00079         /********************************************************************/
00080         rc = connect(sd, (struct sockaddr *)&serveraddr, SUN_LEN(&serveraddr));
00081         if (rc < 0)
00082         {
00083             perror("connect() failed");
00084             break;
00085         }
00086 
00087         length = sizeof(bro_fist_t);
00088         rc = setsockopt(sd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVLOWAT,
00089         (char *)&length, sizeof(length));
00090 
00091         if (rc < 0)
00092         {
00093             perror("setsockopt(SO_RCVLOWAT) failed");
00094             break;
00095         }
00096 
00097         out_packet[0].operation = RADAR_SENSOR;
00098         out_packet[0].port = PORT_1;
00099         out_packet[1].operation = LIGHT_SENSOR;
00100         out_packet[1].port = PORT_2;
00101         out_packet[2].operation = TOUCH_SENSOR;
00102         out_packet[2].port = PORT_3;
00103         out_packet[3].operation = SOUND_SENSOR;
00104         out_packet[3].port = PORT_4;
00105         out_packet[4].operation = TACHO_COUNT;
00106         out_packet[4].port = MOTOR_A;
00107         out_packet[5].operation = TACHO_COUNT;
00108         out_packet[5].port = MOTOR_B;
00109         out_packet[6].operation = TACHO_COUNT;
00110         out_packet[6].port = MOTOR_C;
00111 
00112         /*do {
00113             rc = send(sd, out_packet, sizeof(bro_fist_t) * BUFFER_SIZE, 0);
00114             if (rc < 0)
00115             {
00116                 perror("send() failed");
00117                 break;
00118             }
00119             
00120             printf("%d bytes of data were sent\n", rc);
00121 
00122             rc = recv(sd, in_packet, sizeof(bro_fist_t) * BUFFER_SIZE, 0);
00123             printf("%d bytes of data were received\n", rc);
00124             if (rc < 0)
00125             {
00126                 perror("recv() failed");
00127                 break;
00128             }
00129 
00130             printf ("Received %d bytes\n", rc); 
00131             
00132             for (i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE; i++) {
00133                 printf("%d Packet:\n", i+1);
00134                 printf("\tOperation: %d\n", in_packet[i].operation);
00135                 printf("\tPort: %d\n", in_packet[i].port);
00136                 printf("\tData: %.2f\n\n", in_packet[i].data);
00137             }
00138         } while (1);*/
00139         
00140         begin_trans = time(NULL);
00141     
00142         for (i = 0; i < MSG_NUM; i++) {
00143             rc = send(sd, out_packet, sizeof(bro_fist_t) * BUFFER_SIZE, 0);
00144             if (rc < 0)
00145             {
00146                 perror("send() failed");
00147                 break;
00148             }
00149             
00150 
00151             rc = recv(sd, in_packet, sizeof(bro_fist_t) * BUFFER_SIZE, 0);
00152             if (rc < 0)
00153             {
00154                 perror("recv() failed");
00155                 break;
00156             }
00157             if ((i % 100) == 0) {
00158                 printf ("Reached checkpoint: %i\n", i);
00159             }
00160         }
00161     
00162         end_trans = time (NULL);
00163         
00164         printf ("Ok, all done.\n");
00165         printf ("Esitimated delay: %.2fms\n", (end_trans - begin_trans + 0.0)/MSG_NUM*1000);
00166 
00167         out_packet[0].operation = BRO_END_COMMUNICATION;
00168 
00169         rc = send(sd, out_packet, sizeof(bro_fist_t) * BUFFER_SIZE, 0);
00170         if (rc < 0)
00171         {
00172             perror("send() failed");
00173             break;
00174         }
00175 
00176         } while (FALSE);
00177 
00178     /***********************************************************************/
00179     /* Close down any open socket descriptors                              */
00180     /***********************************************************************/
00181     if (sd != -1)
00182     close(sd);
00183 }
